Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2010 06:42PM laydibug wrote: Hi Brady Out stories are so similar.  I too have pain to the left upper outer quadrant of my breast.  I'm 42 yrs old and have had this pain since I was 16.  It becomes painful when I ovulate and goes away once I get my period.  I have had the area investigated numersous times and it always comes back as nothing.  I too have dense breasts and didn't really know what that ment until I had a routine mamo done back in December.  I was called back for a repeat magnified mamo because the radiologist was concerned with a spot to the lower left aspect of my breast.  I then follow through with an u/s and it turned out to be shadowing.  This whole process took 10 days and I didn't find out that everything was ok until December 23rd.  I too was very worried and can certainly appreciate how you feel right now.  Try to take a deep breath and hold on to the fact that everything to date has been ok. Sending good thoughts your way and I hope all goes well in february....keep us posted.
Posts.Title: Anyone with dense breasts - lump on upper outer quadrant brady0819 ddbaker

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2010 10:51AM laydibug wrote: Hi Brady  Yes mine was the same but with the u/s they did find 6 tiny cyst.  During my mammogram and u/s I was also on the birth control pill and just short of my mentral cycle.  The pill made my breast ginormous (sp?) and I did retain alot of fluid as well, hence the cysts.  I too will be having a f/u scan at the 6 month mark (since stopped the pill)and still continue to worry.  I wish I had the answers to how to shut off the worries but I try to  look at the positive and that is right now all is good.  I think we hear so much about it, we are being educated but we are also somehow indirectly affected by it whether it be friends, relatives or acquintances being afflicted by BC.    I think about it everyday but make myself be optimistic, life is good and I'm/we are being proactive by being on this  site educating ourselves but mostly we are paying attention to our own bodies.
Posts.Title: Anyone with dense breasts - lump on upper outer quadrant brady0819 ddbaker

Posts.Content: Dec 26, 2009 03:46PM laydibug wrote: Hi Travelbug  My story sounds similar to yours.  I'm 42 and had my anual mamogram on the 16th of December and I too was called back for a repeat mamogram.  I have dense breasts and the radiologist was concerned with an area to my left lower breast but thought it might be shadowing.  The mamogram was repeated  and an ultrasound followed.  I am happy to announce that the u/s was clear and all is fine.  I hope this eases your mind a little bit.
Posts.Title: Abnormal Mammogram travelbug47 sweetpea222
